subsection.title: Products
subsection.p: We use the distributive law to remove parentheses from products involving radicals. Compare the product involving radicals on the left with the more familiar use of the distributive law on the right. 6(\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{2}) = 6\sqrt{3} + 6\sqrt{2}~~~~~~~~6(x+y)=6x+6y

solution.p: Apply the distributive law to find \blert{5}(3x+4\sqrt{2}) = \blert{5} \cdot 3x + \blert{5} \cdot 4\sqrt{2} = 15x + 20\sqrt{2}

statement.p: Explain why this statement is incorrect: 5 \cdot 4\sqrt{2} = 20 \cdot 5 \sqrt{2}

subsection.p: In the next example, we use the distributive law along with the product rule to simplify the product.

answer.p: Multiply 3 \cdot 4 to get 12, multiply \sqrt{2}\sqrt{2} to get \sqrt{10}, write the product 12\sqrt{10}.

subsection.p: To multiply binomials, we use the FOIL method.

answer.p: The square root of b is a number that, when multiplied by itself, gives b.

subsection.title: Quotients
subsection.p: We use the quotient rule to simplify square roots of fractions by writing \sqrt{\dfrac{a}{b}} = \dfrac{\sqrt{a}}{\sqrt{b}}. We can also use the quotient rule to simplify quotients of square roots.

statement.p: Is it true that we can only simplify a product or quotient of radicals if they are like radicals?

subsection.title: Fractions
subsection.p: When we solve quadratic equations, the solutions are often fractions that involve square roots. Many such fractions can be simplified using properties of radicals.

statement.p: One of the solutions of the equation 4x^2-8x=1 is \dfrac{8+\sqrt{80}}{8}. Simplify this radical expression.
Which of these cannot be reduced: ~~\dfrac{4+\sqrt{6}}{2}~~ or ~~\dfrac{4\sqrt{6}}{2}~~ Why?

subsection.p: We can add or subtract fractions involving radicals.

subsection.title: Rationalizing the Denominator

statement.p: What does it mean to rationalize the denominator?

answer.p: To eliminate radicals from the denominator.

statement.p: What should you do before trying to rationalize a denominator?

introduction.p: Each simplification is incorrect. Give the correct simplification, or write c.b.s. if the expression cannot be simplified.

The pyramid has five faces, namely, the square base and four triangular sides. We know the height, h, of the pyramid, and the length, s, of the base.
